info.title: OI-Admin - OpenAPI 3.0
info.description:
OI description

Some useful links:
- [One Identity repository](https://github.com/pagopa/oneidentity)
- [The source API definition for OI](https://${server_url}/static/openapi/oas30.json)

post.description: This endpoint follows the specification defined at http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-registration-1_0.html. It enables a client to dynamically register itself as an OAuth 2.0 client.

201.description: Successful registration including details about the registered values.

put.description: This endpoint updates the fields of a Client

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: client_id that was returned in the client registration response

get.description: This endpoint follows the specification defined at http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-registration-1_0.html. It implements the 'registration_client_uri'.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: the user_id of the cognito user

200.description: Successful response including details about the client registration. Additional details may also be included

get.summary: OpenID Connect Dynamic Registration Configuration endpoint

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: the user_id of the cognito user

post.description: This endpoint allow to refresh the secret of a Client

userId.description: The userId of the user who is requesting the client secret refresh. This is required to ensure that only authorized users can refresh the client secret.

newClientSecret.description: The new client secret that has been generated for the client.

post.description: This endpoint creates a user in the Internal IDP

patch.description: This endpoint updates samlAttribrutes for a user in the Internal IDP

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: user_id that is associated to the currently logged in user

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: username of the test user that is being updated

delete.description: This endpoint deletes a user in the Internal IDP

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: user_id that is associated to the currently logged in user

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: username of the test user that is being updated

get.description: This endpoint expose backend function for Client Onboarding Portal.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: user_id that is associated to the currently logged in user

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit the number of results returned, max 50

tags: Admin control panel oidc callback api
post.description: This route will serve the admin control panel oidc callback api

get.description: This route will serve the admin control panel home page
This route will serve the admin control panel dashboard page

responseParameters.method.response.header.Content-Security-: 'default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https://*.pagopa.it; connect-src 'self' https://*.pagopa.it; frame-ancestors 'none';'

tags: Admin control panel dashboard client page
get.description: This route will serve the admin control panel dashboard client page

responseParameters.method.response.header.Content-Security-: 'default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https://*.pagopa.it; connect-src 'self' https://*.pagopa.it; frame-ancestors 'none';'
'default-src 'self'; script-src 'self'; object-src 'none'; style-src 'self' 'unsafe-inline'; img-src 'self' data: https://*.pagopa.it; frame-ancestors 'none';'

methodNotAllowed.description: The HTTP method is not valid

Allow.description: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

unsupportedMediaType.description: The HTTP 415 Unsupported Media Type client error response code indicates that the origin server refuses a particular request because the resource is in a format not supported by the server for HTTP method used.

notAcceptable.description: The HyperText Transfer Protocol (HTTP) 406 Not Acceptable client error response code indicates that the server cannot produce a response matching the list of acceptable values defined in the request's proactive content negotiation headers, and that the server is unwilling to supply a default representation.

unauthorized.description: The client could not be authenticated.

invalidParameters.description: Invalid parameters | Invalid redirect_uri | invalid client type | invalid response type | invalid code_challenge/method | Bad request

userId.description: The userId of the cognito user

defaultAcrValues.description: list of the Authentication Context Class References that this RP supports

samlRequestedAttributes.description: Custom parameter which return all SPID attributes selected, https://docs.italia.it/italia/spid/spid-regole-tecniche/it/stabile/attributi.html

requiredSameIdp.description: If true, the client will get a claim called 'sameIdp' which will contain true if the IDP does not change between two consecutive logins. This is useful for clients that want to know if the user has changed IDP.

backButtonEnabled.description: Boolean which enables the display of the back button in the login page

localizedContentMap.description: Map for localized content for each language

spidMinors.description: Whether the client supports spid for minors

spidProfessionals.description: Whether the client supports spid for professionals

pairwise.description: If true, the client will use pairwise subject identifier

userId.description: The userId of the cognito user

defaultAcrValues.description: list of the Authentication Context Class References that this RP supports

samlRequestedAttributes.description: Custom parameter which return all SPID attributes selected, https://docs.italia.it/italia/spid/spid-regole-tecniche/it/stabile/attributi.html

requiredSameIdp.description: If true, the client will get a claim called 'sameIdp' which will contain true if the IDP does not change between two consecutive logins. This is useful for clients that want to know if the user has changed IDP.

clientIdIssuedAt.description: The timestamp in seconds indicating the time of registration

clientSecretExpiresAt.description: The timestamp in seconds indicating the time of expiration for this value. 0 indicates no expiration

backButtonEnabled.description: Boolean which enables the display of the back button in the login page

localizedContentMap.description: Map for localized content for each language

spidProfessionals.description: Whether the client supports spid for professionals

pairwise.description: If true, the client will use pairwise subject identifier

spidCode.description: The SPID code of the user.

familyName.description: The family name of the user.

placeOfBirth.description: The place of birth of the user.

countyOfBirth.description: The county of birth of the user.

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of the user.

companyName.description: The name of the company associated with the user.

registeredOffice.description: The registered office of the company.

fiscalNumber.description: The fiscal number of the user.

ivaCode.description: The IVA code of the user.

idCard.description: The ID card number of the user.

mobilePhone.description: The mobile phone number of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date of the user's document or session.

digitalAddress.description: The digital address of the user.

domicileAddress.description: The domicile address of the user.

domicilePlace.description: The domicile place of the user.

domicilePostalCode.description: The domicile postal code of the user.

domicileProvince.description: The domicile province of the user.

domicileCountry.description: The domicile country of the user.

commonName.description: The common name of the user.

givenName.description: The given name of the user.

preferredUsername.description: The preferred username of the user.

employeeNumber.description: The employee number of the user.

orgUnitName.description: The organizational unit name of the user.

preferredLanguage.description: The preferred language of the user.

stateOrProvince.description: The state or province of the user.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the user.

street.description: The street address of the user.

username.description: The username of the user to be created.

password.description: The password of the user to be created.

username.description: The username of the user to be created.

password.description: The password of the user to be created.
